image.altText: The exterior of the NT Supreme Court.

props.synopsis: The jury in the trial of a Tiwi Islands man accused of murdering an international student in Darwin hears final arguments from the prosecution and the defence.

title.children: Man accused of student's murder acted in 'chillingly premeditated' way, court hears

image.altText: Two young women and an older woman pose for the camera

props.synopsis: Nineteen-year-old Estella Jones lives with a disability in her hometown of Tennant Creek, where she loves baking brownies, singing karaoke and spending time with good friends.

title.children: What Amy and Estella want you to know about living with disability

image.altText: A multi-storey office building behind a fence.

props.synopsis: A leaked internal memo shows the board of the NT's main legal aid service voted down a proposal to exempt children accused of crimes from sweeping service cuts.

title.children: Memo shows Legal Aid NT board rejected service cuts exemption for children

image.altText: Empty bottles of spirits on a red dirt road.

props.synopsis: In the final hours of parliament for the year, the government has extended the time a person issued with a Banned Drinker Order is prevented from drinking alcohol.

title.children: NT parliament pushes through banned drinking register changes on urgency

image.altText: A woman with dark hair standing in a park, she is wearing a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: A year after NT Coroner Elisabeth Armitage handed down 35 recommendations from a landmark domestic violence inquest, those on the frontline say things are going backwards.

title.children: Is violence worsening in the region with Australia's highest rates of DV?

image.altText: A large white building with a metal coat of arms out the front.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory parliament has passed a bill creating an Integrity and Ethics Commissioner. It will take responsibility for four integrity bodies in the territory, including the anti-corruption watchdog.

title.children: NT Integrity and Ethics Commissioner established amid opposition

image.altText: A group of people standing outside of court, holding a sign that reads "Save our springs".

props.synopsis: Dozens of Aboriginal Territorians from remote communities travelled to Darwin where they stand alongside Environment Centre NT in a bid to axe a controversial water allocation plan.

title.children: 'Ancient and fragile': Dispute over groundwater reaches Supreme Court

image.altText: A huge hole in the roof of a classroom.

props.synopsis: Staff have been evacuated from a remote boarding school on the Tiwi Islands, and students may not be able to return to classrooms this year, after Ex-Tropical Cyclone Fina tore through the region with devastating force on Saturday night.

title.children: Staff evacuated, calls for ADF help after Cyclone Fina wrecks school

image.altText: person who is blurred walks in front of the new york stock exchange, sign says wall street

props.synopsis: Exchange operator CME Group said trading in derivative markets was halted due to a cooling issue at data centres. The tech issue is affecting Wall Street futures trading.

title.children: Global financial markets flying blind as US futures market halted due to 'technical issue'

image.altText: An Asian woman, a blonde woman, a man in security uniform, woman with a dog, a young blonde girl and a European woman.

props.synopsis: A lawyer representing one of the bereaved families took aim at the owner and operator of Westfield, saying they were "extremely disappointed".

title.children: Family of security guard killed in Bondi stabbing upset with Westfield

image.altText: Police officers next to a police car

props.synopsis: A man aged in his 20s has died after being shot multiple times near a police station in Western Sydney.

title.children: Man shot dead in Sydney street, two arrested after police pursuit

image.altText: Benedict Bryant leaving

props.synopsis: Benedict Bryant had pleaded not guilty to dangerous driving occasioning death over the crash in inner Sydney in February 2022, which killed Jai Wright.

title.children: 'This should be the outcome': Officer guilty over fatal police pursuit crash

image.altText: A girl with blue eyes and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Kieren Daniel Mittelheuser has been charged with attempting to pervert justice, along with accessory to murder.

title.children: Fresh charge for Pheobe Bishop accused

image.altText: Two people wrapped in blankets watching the fires at Wang Fuk Court.

props.synopsis: Hong Kong's deadliest fire in decades tore through a group of high-rise residential towers in a densely packed housing estate, causing major issues for firefighters. This is how the catastrophe unfolded.

title.children: With each passing hour, a major Hong Kong fire only became more deadly

image.altText: a beach from overhead with vegetation and a short stretch of sand

props.synopsis: The former nurse accused of the 2018 murder of Toyah Cordingley was 3.7 billion times more likely than not to have contributed to a DNA sample found on a stick where she was buried, his trial has heard.

title.children: DNA samples found near Toyah Cordingley burial site scrutinised

image.altText: A child and a woman wade through the water on a flooded street in Medan in North Sumatra in Indonesia.

props.synopsis: The death toll is expected to continue rising after a week of record-breaking rain, flash flooding and a "rare" tropical cyclone.

title.children: 'Rare' tropical cyclone thrashes South-East Asia as death toll hits 115

image.altText: Corporate Travel Management executive chairman Jamie Pherous.

props.synopsis: Corporate Travel Management helps arrange travel bookings for clients ranging from Wesfarmers to the Australian government.

title.children: Travel company embroiled in overcharging scandal worth more than $100m

image.altText: A crystal egg is open to reveal a tiny basket of jeweled white flowers inside.

props.synopsis: A rare crystal and diamond Fabergé egg is heading to auction with a price estimate of more than $40 million.

title.children: 'Mona Lisa for decorative arts': Rare Fabergé egg set for $40m sale

image.altText: Two people sit talking in an outdoor setting.

props.synopsis: As Gardening Australia's longest-serving presenter, Jane Edmanson says farewell and shares the secrets behind the success of Australia’s favourite gardening program.

title.children: After 38 years, Jane Edmanson is hanging up her Gardening Australia gloves

image.altText: A split-screen image of a man and a woman, both wearing National Guard uniforms.

props.synopsis: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, has died in hospital after an ambush shooting near the White House on Wednesday. A male soldier who was also shot, Andrew Wolfe, is fighting for his life, the president says.

title.children: National Guard soldier gunned down near White House dies in hospital

image.altText: Soldiers standing on the side of a building with two other men near a broken garage door on the ground

props.synopsis: Video has emerged appearing to show two Palestinians being 'executed' by Israeli forces in the West Bank, with the Israeli military saying it has launched an investigation into the incident.

title.children: Video appears to show Israeli soldiers 'executing' two Palestinians in West Bank

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man in science lab.

props.synopsis: An 86-year-old farmer claims this year's Dairy Science Award for inventing spreadable butter, by mixing oils with cultured cream at a time when it was illegal.

title.children: Dairy 'disrupter' who invented spreadable butter in 70s wins science award

image.altText: An aerial photo of the Bathurst Lighthouse in front of a series of premium tents at Rottnest Island.

props.synopsis: A strife-torn Aboriginal corporation crucial to heritage approvals across Perth wins a contract to oversee cultural services on Rottnest Island, Wadjemup, one of Western Australia's premier tourism destinations.

title.children: Embattled Aboriginal corporation to oversee cultural services at Rottnest Island

image.altText: A group of formally dressed people smile and hold trophies in celebration in a group portrait on the edge of a stage.

props.synopsis: The pair's investigation had an immediate impact on Australia's childcare industry, resulting in the suspension of one centre and a raft of government policy changes and safety reforms.

title.children: ABC's Adele Ferguson, Chris Gillett win Gold Walkley for childcare investigation

image.altText: A white sign on a building reading "Monash IVF"

props.synopsis: Monash IVF has been ordered to be more rigorous when checking the biological origin of embryos to avoid more mix-ups, in order to stay registered in Victoria.

title.children: Major IVF provider hit with restrictions after embryo bungle

image.altText: A teenager looks down at a smartphone screen displaying the Snapchat logo, a yellow screen with a white ghost cartoon

props.synopsis: As the social media ban for kids under 16 approaches, popular messaging app Snapchat says young people will be able to verify their age by sending a selfie or their ID to a third-party platform, but sharing sensitive data carries risks.

title.children: Cybersecurity experts alarmed by Snapchat's age-verification plan

image.altText: Metro bus

props.synopsis: Tasmania's education department and a bus company have both appeared in court after a child with a disability was allegedly left unattended on a bus with access to a bottle of engine coolant in a plastic water bottle.

title.children: Child’s attempt to drink engine coolant on school bus leads to legal action

image.altText: Officer holds up large bag of drugs at police headquarters

props.synopsis: Police say a man has been charged for allegedly carrying $2.75 million worth of illicit drugs while travelling on a bus from Melbourne to Adelaide overnight.

title.children: Man allegedly travelled with $2.75m drug haul on bus from Melbourne to Adelaide

image.altText: Breanna Koenen and Jasmine Garner hold the premiership cup

props.synopsis: Wondering what time the AFLW grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

title.children: Everything you need to know ahead of the 2025 AFLW grand final

image.altText: Environment Minister Murray Watt walks in the Senate.

props.synopsis: The environmental deal is a major win for a government whose critics on the left are calling for it to be more reformist.

title.children: Greens out-step flat-footed Liberals on crucial deal

image.altText: Broken down on the Birdsville Track

props.synopsis: The ABC's Landline crew discovers extreme kindness with a can-do attitude after a mechanical breakdown in South Australia's outback.

title.children: Broken down on the Birdsville Track in search of a cattle-carrying boat

image.altText: Building materials tested for asbestos.

props.synopsis: An anti-asbestos advocate wants a review of import supply chains after a third renewable energy company confirmed the discovery of asbestos in wind farm turbine lifts.

title.children: Third renewable energy company discovers asbestos in wind farm turbine lifts

image.altText: Police officers standing in the backyard of a house.

props.synopsis: Wayne Pedro Morseu was reported missing on November 10, with police now upgrading his disappearance to suspicious.

title.children: Crime scenes declared in North Qld over man's suspicious disappearance

image.altText: A man with a beard and grey hair on an old boat

props.synopsis: A coroner has found Anthony Higgins, who went missing in 2020 sparking the largest and most expensive marine search in South Australian waters, died two weeks later when he went missing again.

title.children: Boatie who went missing twice died from 'exposure to the sea'

image.altText: A headland view of a beach

props.synopsis: The Swiss consulate says it is providing support for the relatives of two Swiss nationals who were attacked by a bull shark on the NSW Mid North Coast.

title.children: Consulate 'supporting the relatives' of Swiss shark attack victims
